camel.source.path.type.name: camel.source.path.type
camel.source.path.type.description: Operation to perform. Consumers: NewIssues, NewComments. Producers: AddIssue, AttachFile, DeleteIssue, TransitionIssue, UpdateIssue, Watchers. See this class javadoc description for more information. One of: [ADDCOMMENT] [ADDISSUE] [ATTACH] [DELETEISSUE] [NEWISSUES] [NEWCOMMENTS] [WATCHUPDATES] [UPDATEISSUE] [TRANSITIONISSUE] [WATCHERS] [ADDISSUELINK] [ADDWORKLOG] [FETCHISSUE] [FETCHCOMMENTS]

camel.source.endpoint.delay.name: camel.source.endpoint.delay
camel.source.endpoint.delay.description: Time in milliseconds to elapse for the next poll.

camel.source.endpoint.jiraUrl.name: camel.source.endpoint.jiraUrl
camel.source.endpoint.jiraUrl.description: The Jira server url, example: http://my_jira.com:8081

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.jql.name: camel.source.endpoint.jql
camel.source.endpoint.jql.description: JQL is the query language from JIRA which allows you to retrieve the data you want. For example jql=project=MyProject Where MyProject is the product key in Jira. It is important to use the RAW() and set the JQL inside it to prevent camel parsing it, example: RAW(project in (MYP, COM) AND resolution = Unresolved)

camel.source.endpoint.maxResults.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxResults
camel.source.endpoint.maxResults.description: Max number of issues to search for

camel.source.endpoint.sendOnlyUpdatedFie.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendOnlyUpdatedField
camel.source.endpoint.sendOnlyUpdatedFie.description: Indicator for sending only changed fields in exchange body or issue object. By default consumer sends only changed fields.

camel.source.endpoint.watchedFields.name: camel.source.endpoint.watchedFields
camel.source.endpoint.watchedFields.description: Comma separated list of fields to watch for changes. Status,Priority are the defaults.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.accessToken.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessToken
camel.source.endpoint.accessToken.description: (OAuth only) The access token generated by the Jira server.

camel.source.endpoint.consumerKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerKey
camel.source.endpoint.consumerKey.description: (OAuth only) The consumer key from Jira settings.

camel.source.endpoint.password.name: camel.source.endpoint.password
camel.source.endpoint.password.description: (Basic authentication only) The password to authenticate to the Jira server. Use only if username basic authentication is used.

camel.source.endpoint.privateKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.privateKey
camel.source.endpoint.privateKey.description: (OAuth only) The private key generated by the client to encrypt the conversation to the server.

camel.source.endpoint.username.name: camel.source.endpoint.username
camel.source.endpoint.username.description: (Basic authentication only) The username to authenticate to the Jira server. Use only if OAuth is not enabled on the Jira server. Do not set the username and OAuth token parameter, if they are both set, the username basic authentication takes precedence.

camel.source.endpoint.verificationCode.name: camel.source.endpoint.verificationCode
camel.source.endpoint.verificationCode.description: (OAuth only) The verification code from Jira generated in the first step of the authorization proccess.

camel.component.jira.delay.name: camel.component.jira.delay
camel.component.jira.delay.description: Time in milliseconds to elapse for the next poll.

camel.component.jira.jiraUrl.name: camel.component.jira.jiraUrl
camel.component.jira.jiraUrl.description: The Jira server url, example: http://my_jira.com:8081

camel.component.jira.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.jira.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.jira.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.jira.basicPropertyBindin.name: camel.component.jira.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.jira.basicPropertyBindin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.jira.configuration.name: camel.component.jira.configuration
camel.component.jira.configuration.description: To use a shared base jira configuration.

camel.component.jira.accessToken.name: camel.component.jira.accessToken
camel.component.jira.accessToken.description: (OAuth only) The access token generated by the Jira server.

camel.component.jira.consumerKey.name: camel.component.jira.consumerKey
camel.component.jira.consumerKey.description: (OAuth only) The consumer key from Jira settings.

camel.component.jira.password.name: camel.component.jira.password
camel.component.jira.password.description: (Basic authentication only) The password to authenticate to the Jira server. Use only if username basic authentication is used.

camel.component.jira.privateKey.name: camel.component.jira.privateKey
camel.component.jira.privateKey.description: (OAuth only) The private key generated by the client to encrypt the conversation to the server.

camel.component.jira.username.name: camel.component.jira.username
camel.component.jira.username.description: (Basic authentication only) The username to authenticate to the Jira server. Use only if OAuth is not enabled on the Jira server. Do not set the username and OAuth token parameter, if they are both set, the username basic authentication takes precedence.

camel.component.jira.verificationCode.name: camel.component.jira.verificationCode
camel.component.jira.verificationCode.description: (OAuth only) The verification code from Jira generated in the first step of the authorization proccess.
